      • length

        public double length()
        Function for retrieving the length of the Vector.
        Returns:
        the length of the Vector.

      • updateLength

        private void updateLength()
        Function for updating the stored length of the Vector. This is necessary since calculating it over and over again would create unnecessary cpu work.

      • getNeededMultiplier

        public java.lang.Double getNeededMultiplier(Point point)
        Function for determining the multiplier (r) with which the current Vector calculates the X and Y values of the given Point.
        Parameters:
        point - the Point the current Vector has to end at.
        Returns:
        either the multiplier with which the targeted Vector (-> Point) is being reached or null, if the Point can not be reached.

      • getIntersection

        public Point getIntersection(Vector vectorB)
        Function for getting the intersection between this Vector and another one.
        Parameters:
        vectorB - the Vector the check is done against.
        Returns:
        the Point at which both Vectors intersect each other or null if they do not intersect each other.

      • getCrossProduct

        public double getCrossProduct(Vector vectorB)
        Function for generating the cross product between this vector and another given one.
        Parameters:
        vectorB - another Vector with which the cross product is calculated.
        Returns:
        the cross product between this and the given Vector.

      • normalize

        public void normalize()
        Normalizes the Vector.

      • setToLength

        public void setToLength(double length)
        Sets the Vector to a specific length.
        Parameters:
        length - the length that the Vector is supposed to have.

      • getScalarProduct

        public double getScalarProduct(Vector vectorB)
        Function for generating the scalar / dot product of the current and a given Vector.
        Parameters:
        vectorB - the Vector the scalar product is calculated with.
        Returns:
        the scalar / dot product of the current and the given Vector.

      • getAngleToVector

        public double getAngleToVector(Vector vectorB)
        Function for calculating the angle of this Vector to another given one in degrees.
        Parameters:
        vectorB - the Vector the angle is calculated to.
        Returns:
        the angle of this Vector to another given one in degrees.

        See Also:

      • display

        public void display(bwapi.Color color,
                    boolean showDirection)
        Convenience function. If the direction flag is set the values being used are the default ones.
        Overrides:
        display in class Point
        Parameters:
        color - the color of the displayed Vector.
        showDirection - flag for determining if the direction of the Vector should be shown with an arrow.
        See Also:
        display(Color, boolean, int, int)

      • display

        public void display(bwapi.Color color,
                    boolean showDirection,
                    int arrowLength,
                    int arrowAngleDeg)
        Function for displaying the Vector on the ingame map.
        Parameters:
        color - the color of the displayed Vector.
        showDirection - flag for determining if the direction of the Vector should be shown with an arrow.
        arrowLength - the length of the arrow head sides. Can be ignored if the direction flag is not set.
        arrowAngleDeg - the degree at which the arrow head sides are shown. Can be ignored if the direction flag is not set.
